text: this is noir and my dream is to go to
the United States
mainly about the US is the the culture
the history the history is very very
interesting like especially Thanksgiving
Day the Independence Day I've heard a
lot about that and that looks very
interesting to me actually nor comes
from the third biggest city in
Afghanistan called mazar-e-sharif which
is a beautiful place inside and out but
sadly he suffered a childhood that
nobody should ever experience in 90s it
was just the beginning of Taliban and
then they they're quite powerful they
came to measure sure if they attacked
another Sherif I was like an 11 years
old kid at that time I was just going to
school he told me that if someone was
caught stealing they will cut off your
hand and hang it publicly on a tree it
was a tough time like all the people
like back there's the city of
mazar-e-sharif like all the people from
mazar-e-sharif they have to escape and
came towards this mountain
the Taliban airplane was bombing
everywhere here on the desert and like
they were bombing over the people and
was of the people they lost their life
between this desert from lazar Sharif to
this mountain so his family fled to
Pakistan as refugees for several months
we crossed the borders illegally and we
went to Pakistan before coming back once
the Taliban was defeated in 2001 when
Noor went back to school he developed a
strong interest in English so he started
teaching himself through music I
listened to the song I drove all night
by sundown and I really wanted to know
what was the meaning and it was movies
like Spider Man 2 which he watched
hundreds of times that introduced him to
American culture so we started studying
American history and learning American
English fluently in the complete course
in American slang and idioms in 2007 he
won the top English speaking contest in
Afghanistan out of 2,000 participants
and was given a chance to go to the u.s.
to study a family in Florida had already
accepted him and arranged to be his host
family for a year but when he went to
the u.s. embassy to get the visa he was
denied for unknown reasons so then he
went to work getting a position at the
UN as an English teacher and then
working on several projects with the US
aid in 2013 he started guiding tours on
his holidays because he wanted to change
outsider's perspectives on his beloved
country
find my American clients to be some of
the friendliest in 2015 he got married
to a beautiful wife had an adorable son
and started an official tour company
called lesbifriends Afghanistan now he
leads tours to about 60 clients a year
myself being one of them what's up man
so right now we're reading in the back
of a rickshaw we've spent every second
of the last six days together and he's
an amazing guy with such a kind heart he
has paid for his parents to move back to
Mazar for his brother to go to school
and compete as a number one multi
fighter in Afghanistan but nor has still
never given up on his dream to go to the
United States of America it doesn't
matter that he carries the weakest
passport in the world or the fact that
he was already denied once I am
confident that this man will get a
chance to go and whenever he does I will
be there to show him around just like
he's done for me
